author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> after some discussion with @dankrad, my current thinking that the uniqueness checks are unnecessary. in particular, it doesn't change the safety/honesty assumption, it is still one-of-n. from chatting with you, these checks were some of the more complicated/slowest to perform. furthermore, a malicious participant could trivially avoid them by participating twice such that their two contributions multiply to the same secret but using different factors. so as far as i can see, the only benefit of this check is that it *looks* better from a narative standpoint if we do not see any duplicate `pot_pubkeys`, but that has no effect on the security.
